author: Yle News
title: Sleet and snow showers causing dangerous driving conditions
text: Driving conditions are hazardous across many parts of Finland on Friday due to a series of sleet and snow showers. Fintraffic's regional office in Tampere has warned of especially challenging road conditions in the area, while the Finnish Meteorological Institute has issued a hazardous driving conditions warning for southern and central regions ‚Äî which is in effect until 6am on Saturday morning. Conditions are particularly bad in the regions of Kanta- and P√§ij√§t-H√§me, Kymenlaakso and Pirkanmaa, the FMI noted. "Now is the time to change to the friction or studded winter tyres, if someone hasn't done it yet. Now it's definitely winter tyre time nationwide," Kimmo Fager of Fintraffic said. Matthew Schilke of Yle News explained the new regulations around winter tyres in an Instagram reel. Temperatures drop to -17 in Lapland Thursday night was the coldest of the season so far, with the temperature dropping to -16.7 degrees Celsius in Sodankyl√§, Finnish Lapland, according to the FMI. Despite the subzero temperatures, driving conditions in the region of Finnish Lapland are relatively good, Fintraffic noted. The forecast for the weekend suggests cloudy conditions in many parts of the country, with rain showers in the south and east. Temperatures during the day on Saturday will range from 5 degrees Celsius in the south to -2 in Finnish Lapland. The outlook for next week is for milder temperatures, with no more snow in the forecast. Users with an Yle ID can leave comments on our news stories. You can create your Yle ID via this link . Our guidelines on commenting and moderation are explained here .

author: Glasgow Times
title: Arsenal‚Äôs title hopes hit as old boy Mavropanos helps West Ham to win
text:
The Guardian Arsenal‚Äôs title hopes hit as old boy Mavropanos seals West Ham win Read full article Jacob Steinberg at the Emirates Stadium 29 December 2023 at 0:17 am ¬∑ 5-min read Photograph: Peter Cziborra/Action Images/Reuters
This was not the reunion that Arsenal envisaged. On a night when West Ham ‚Äôs discipline and tremendous work ethic turned the Emirates Stadium into a pit of frustration, Declan Rice found himself powerless to resist as the narrative shifted to the goal from Konstantinos Mavropanos that raises further doubts over his old side‚Äôs staying power in the title race.
Mikel Arteta has every reason to be concerned after a defeat that dashed Arsenal‚Äôs hopes of returning to the top of the Premier League. Statistics showing his side had 74% possession and finished a taut encounter with 30 shots to West Ham‚Äôs five spoke less of their dominance and more to their toothlessness and indecision in the final third. As Arteta acknowledged, supremacy in the middle hardly feels relevant when it is accompanied by such a lack of conviction in both boxes.
Related: Arsenal 0-2 West Ham: Premier League ‚Äì live reaction
By full-time Arsenal, who remain two points behind Liverpool and three ahead of Manchester City , had managed 77 touches in West Ham‚Äôs area. Two went to Gabriel Jesus , only for the hard-running No 9 to spurn a couple of glorious headed chances midway through the second half.
They were pivotal moments, the kind that might have turned the game on its head, but there is a reason why City let Jesus go. Their view was that the striker was not potent enough and, for all the Brazilian‚Äôs excellent work off the ball, it is easy to understand the argument about Arsenal needing more firepower in January.
At the moment they look reliant on Bukayo Saka , a weakness that West Ham exploited by crowding the winger out. Gabriel Martinelli , who was marked out of the game by the outstanding Vladimir Coufal, is simply not offering any threat on the opposite flank. Martinelli has only two league goals this season and, with Kai Havertz missing through suspension, the use of Leandro Trossard in midfield was not enough to break West Ham down.
This was a solid, committed performance from West Ham, who rose to sixth after consecutive 2-0 wins against Arsenal and Manchester United . For David Moyes, who celebrated his first league win in 73 attempts away against Arsenal, Chelsea , Liverpool and United, it was a tactical triumph.
Story continues Time to give him a new deal? The evidence is compelling. West Ham may lack glamour but nobody can accuse them of being a soft touch under Moyes. They fought for everything after snatching the lead through Tomas Soucek and, having survived a storm before half-time, were in the clear when Mavropanos, a centre-back who made little impact before leaving Arsenal in 2022, headed in James Ward-Prowse‚Äôs corner early in the second half.
Mavropanos‚Äôs first goal since joining West Ham from Stuttgart hit Arsenal hard. They were under pressure after wins for City and Liverpool earlier in the week. They were desperate for an early goal. Martin √òdegaard linked with Saka, who tested Alphonse Areola . Emerson Palmieri, West Ham‚Äôs adventurous left-back, would have to dig deep against Saka.
West Ham had conceded five in each of their previous two away outings and were without Nayef Aguerd and Kurt Zouma in central defence. Deputising for Aguerd and Zouma were Mavropanos and Angelo Ogbonna , the pairing that started when West Ham were demolished by Liverpool in the Carabao Cup.
A notable feature, though, was the tenacious Edson √Ålvarez dropping back to help West Ham‚Äôs defence. They soon tiptoed forward. Lucas Paquet√°, who had started despite injuring a knee during the warm-up, took over, spinning cleverly before finding Emerson‚Äôs overlapping run.
The left-back‚Äôs cross caught Arsenal out. Jarrod Bowen missed it at the near post but Gabriel Magalh√£es and Oleksandr Zinchenko were in a muddle. The ball came back to Bowen, who pulled it back from the byline for Soucek to score from close range.
There would be no reprieve from VAR for Arsenal, no replay to show the ball had gone behind before being funnelled to Soucek, and the anxiety rose. It grew further when Areola tipped Saka‚Äôs header over and Martinelli shot wide.
West Ham were hit when Paquet√° went down again, depriving the visitors of their most accomplished player on the ball. Retaining possession was harder with Sa√Ød Benrahma on. Arsenal upped the pace. Saka hit woodwork after wriggling through. Soucek and Ogbonna made vital blocks.
Download the Guardian app from the iOS App Store on iPhone or the Google Play store on Android by searching for 'The Guardian'.
If you already have the Guardian app, make sure you‚Äôre on the most recent version.
In the Guardian app, tap the Menu button at the bottom right, then go to Settings (the gear icon), then Notifications.
Turn on sport notifications.
It had been 45 minutes of pure Moyesball. Mohammed Kudus worked tirelessly on West Ham‚Äôs right, tracking back and occasionally relieving pressure with neat footwork. Arsenal struggled to find space. Rice shot over from 20 yards but openings were rare after half-time and the angst grew when Mavropanos, running across Magalh√£es, met Ward-Prowse‚Äôs delivery with a header that went in off the bar.
Arsenal‚Äôs response came from Jesus wasting headers and Trossard firing at Areola‚Äôs legs. There was time for Rice to concede a penalty for fouling Emerson. David Raya ‚Äôs save from Benrahma was of little consolation to Arsenal.
TRENDING 1. Experience: I‚Äôm a world champion pea thrower 2. The 10 greatest commentary moments in sports history 3. When is Dancing on Ice 2024 and who are the hosts? 4. At least 30 E.coli cases could be linked to recalled cheese, say health officials 5. Strictly Come Dancing star John Whaite pulls out of stage role due to illness

author: Redazione ANSA
title: Pd, il 2023 anno fallimentare per la giunta Acquaroli - La Regione informa - Ansa.it
text: La sanit√† con le sue lunghe liste di attesa, le infrastrutture "con un aeroporto che perder√† i voli di continuit√† territoriale", una crescita economica "tra le pi√π basse di Italia", un piano casa "inesistente", povert√† in crescita nelle Marche e gli sfollati del terremoto di Ancona del 9 novembre dello scorso anno "ancora senza risposte". Sono le falle elencate dal gruppo assembleare del Partito Democratico per la giunta del governatore Francesco Acquaroli. Un bilancio del 2023 come "un anno di fallimenti, uguali ai due precedenti" secondo i dem. Il capogruppo Maurizio Mangialardi ha definito l'attuale giunta "un disastro" con un presidente "nervoso e stizzato che ha lasciato l'aula senza nemmeno salutare". Secondo il capogruppo, la salute rischia "di non essere pi√π un diritto fondamentale e universale ma un privilegio per pochi" con un sistema sanitario regionale che nega "nega prestazioni a malati oncologici, a bambini cardiopatici, con i pronto soccorso che esplodono". A rincarare la dose sul tema il consigliere Romano Carancini, vicepresidente della Commissione Salute, polemico sulla nomina del sottosegretario Aldo Salvi "per commissariare di fatto l'assessore Saltamartini". Bocciato il passaggio delle aree vaste ad aziende sanitarie territoriali, che doveva far funzionare meglio il Cup, ma che "sono mesi che non d√† risposte, abbiamo le liste d'attesa tra le peggiori in Italia". La segretaria Pd Marche Chantal Bomprezzi ha puntato il dito sull'esecutivo Acquaroli, "che non si rapporta pi√π con il territorio". Per Fabrizio Cesetti, "il diritto alla salute sancito dalla Costituzione non √® pi√π garantito, il piano socio sanitario non stanzia le risorse necessarie". La vice presidente del gruppo Pd Anna Casini ha sottolineato l'inutilit√† della legge urbanistica perch√© "inapplicabile e dannosa, Province e Comuni hanno chiesto chiarimenti perch√© non riescono ad applicarla". Una Regione che "fa finta di niente anche per gli esodati del superbonus" ha insistito. E in tema di sanit√†, secondo la consigliera Micaela Vitri, "la giunta Acquaroli non e riuscita ad uilizzare nemmeno la met√† dei fondi disponibili per la riduzione delle liste di attesa". Nelle Marche le donne attenderebbero fino a 251 giorni per una mammografia bilaterale. Il consigliere Antonio Mariovincenzo ha chiarito che aumentano gli occupati "ma con contratti precari, mal retribuiti e di breve periodo". L'industria manifatturiera regionale "chiude il terzo trimestre con ativit√† produttiva e commerciale in calo". Marche all'ultimo posto in Italia per imprese giovanili. Per le infrastrutture √® stata la consigliera Manuela Bora a sottolineare che "il servizio aereo su Milano, Roma e Napoli non √® economicamente sostenibile, fallito l'obiettivo di far uscire le Marche dall'isolamento". Il gruppo ha fatto un elenco di "13 promesse disattese" dove rientrano, oltre l'abbattimento delle liste di attesa, anche "il contrasto alla denatalit√†, la formazione per creare occupazione, la cultura e l'ambiente". Riproduzione riservata ¬© Copyright ANSA

author: Olalekan Adigun
title: L.A. Rams and Edwards Lifesciences Tackle Heart Health in Inglewood: Free Screenings in Black History Month
text:
In a heartfelt initiative during Black History Month and American Heart Month, the L.A. Rams teamed up with Edwards Lifesciences to offer free heart screenings at Faithful Central Bible Church in Inglewood. This event, part of a broader effort to combat heart disease‚Äîa leading cause of death in the U.S.‚Äîfocused on the African American community, which is disproportionately affected by this condition. Dr. Cedric Cravens, from Edwards Lifesciences, emphasized the importance of education and awareness to tackle heart and heart valve diseases.
Screening for a Stronger Heart
The event boasted two informational sessions on heart health, alongside screenings that included blood pressure checks, electrocardiograms, and echocardiograms. Experts like Dr. Tiffany Randolph, a non-invasive cardiologist, highlighted lifestyle changes and awareness as key factors in preventing cardiovascular disease. The involvement of the Rams and Edwards Lifesciences underlined the critical need for community engagement and support in addressing health disparities, particularly in underserved communities.
Community Impact and Awareness
George B. Thompson, a pastor at Faithful Central Bible Church, and attendees like Nannette Griggs highlighted the significance of such initiatives. They noted the essential role of education and the power of community support to extend the reach and impact of health interventions. The event not only provided vital health screenings but also fostered a sense of unity and collective action towards better health outcomes in the African American community.
Bridging Health Disparities
Events like these underscore the importance of addressing social determinants of health and the disparities in access to care. Research shows that community-based interventions and a team-based approach to cardiovascular care can significantly improve health outcomes in underserved populations. Moreover, resources like those provided by East Alabama Health offer valuable guidance for the African American community on leading healthier lives and mitigating the risks of heart disease.
The initiative by the L.A. Rams and Edwards Lifesciences in Inglewood stands as a beacon of hope and a model for future health-focused community outreach. It highlights the crucial role of awareness, education, and proactive health management in bridging the gap in healthcare disparities, especially among African Americans. By fostering community engagement and providing free access to essential health screenings, this initiative moves us closer to a future where health equity is a reality for all.

author: @AboyAgustin
title: Futuro en el Santiago Bernab√©u: la renovaci√≥n de contrato de Ra√∫l Asencio con el Real Madrid | Sporting News Spain
text:
Ra√∫l Asencio est√° dispuesto a asegurar su futuro en el Real Madrid , con un nuevo contrato a largo plazo se espera que se firme en las pr√≥ximas semanas.
Asencio, de 21 a√±os, ha sido uno de los jugadores m√°s destacados del equipo de Carlo Ancelotti esta temporada, en la que ha dado un paso al frente en medio de las lesiones de los veteranos de su puesto.
Seg√∫n Fabrizio Romano el acuerdo est√° casi cerrado y solamente faltan algunos detalles. Tanto el club como el jugador est√°n deseosos de continuar su v√≠nculo, y no hay dudas de que el acuerdo se alcanzar√° pronto.
Por qu√© Real Madrid est√° convencido de renovar el contrato de Ra√∫l Asencio Asencio ha desempe√±ado un papel crucial para el Real Madrid esta temporada, sobre todo en la ausencia de √âder Militao y David Alaba, que han luchado con lesiones de larga duraci√≥n.
Ancelotti ha tenido que recurrir a Antonio R√ºdiger como √∫nica presencia constante en la zaga, y Asencio ha demostrado ser un compa√±ero fiable.
Sus actuaciones en partidos clave, como los choques de Champions League contra Manchester City y Atl√©tico de Madrid, le han dado la confianza del cuerpo t√©cnico.
Seg√∫n Squawka, Asencio no cometi√≥ faltas, gan√≥ sus nueve duelos y complet√≥ 95/100 pases en esos dos partidos de la UCL, y eso sin Rudiger al lado.
No R√ºdiger, no problem. üòÄ
Ra√∫l Asencio stepped up against Atl√©tico Madrid and Man City in the last two games, winning 100% of his duels in both matches.
‚óâ 5/5 duels won vs. Atleti
‚óâ 4/4 duels won vs. Man City
He also won all four of his tackles, completed 95 of his 100‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/7Oxn5TAC07
‚Äî Squawka (@Squawka) February 12, 2025 A pesar de que su actual contrato expira en 2026, el Real Madrid quiere asegurar su futuro por un per√≠odo m√°s largo, asegurando la estabilidad en su l√≠nea defensiva.
Romano se refiri√≥ al acuerdo: "Los √∫ltimos detalles se concretar√°n en las pr√≥ximas semanas, pero no hay dudas por ambas partes. Asencio firmar√° un nuevo contrato en el club".
El defensor est√° totalmente comprometido con el club blanco. Los informes sugieren que su "√∫nico deseo es triunfar en el Real Madrid", lo que refuerza a√∫n m√°s la confianza del club a la hora de ofrecerle un contrato ampliado.
Con 29 partidos esta temporada, 20 de ellos como titular, Asencio ha demostrado su val√≠a en los grandes escenarios. Su reciente convocatoria con la selecci√≥n espa√±ola pone de manifiesto su r√°pido ascenso y su creciente reputaci√≥n.
Los fan√°ticos del Real Madrid estar√°n encantados de ver a otro joven talento comprometiendo su futuro con el club, especialmente en una temporada en la que la profundidad de la plantilla se ha puesto a prueba debido a las lesiones.

author: David Su√°rez
title: PARQUES ACU√ÅTICOS EN GALICIA | Cinco parques acu√°ticos preto de Santiago para combater a calor este ver√°n
text: Con la llegada porfin del buen tiempo a Galicia, muchos comenzamos a hacer planes en familia en los que las actividades al aire libre son las protagonistas. Y es que en nuestra comunidad, adem√°s de las playas de los 1.498 km de costa y la multitud de parajes que encontramos ba√±ados por los r√≠os, hay otra muy buena opci√≥n para combatir el calor: los parques acu√°ticos. Una actividad ideal para el disfrute con los m√°s peque√±os de la casa y cuya demanda aumenta que cada a√±o. A continuaci√≥n te hacemos una recomendaci√≥n de cinco de los m√°s cercanos a Santiago de Compostela. El Aquapark de Cerceda, situado en la provincia de A Coru√±a, es el m√°s popular de Galicia. Estren√≥ la temporada el 10 de junio y permanecer√° abierto todos los d√≠as hasta el pr√≥ximo mes de septiembre. Se trata de un parque con varios toboganes, piscinas con chorros de agua y atracciones a las que acompa√±a una gran zona verde. Consulta disponibilidad y precios clickando en este enlace. Aunque los parques acu√°ticos suelen estar relacionados con recintos llenos de piscinas y toboganes, lo cierto es que de un tiempo para aqu√≠, existen aquellos que temporalmente se instalan en algunos arenales como es el caso del de Sanxenxo. Ubicado en la playa de Baltar, consta de un √°rea de m√°s de 1.750 metros cuadrados, lo que lo convierte en el parque flotante m√°s grande de Espa√±a. Este recinto lleva abierto al p√∫blico desde el pasado 15 de junio, y puedes consultar disponibilidad y precios clickando en este enlace. Gestionado por la empresa compostelana Osventos, Galicia cuenta este verano con un nuevo aquapark a pleno rendimiento. Situado en Pereiro de Aguiar (Ourense), abri√≥ sus puertas en agosto de 2023, tras un retraso en las obras provocado por la demora en la entrega de los materiales debido a la crisis que provoc√≥ la guerra en Ucrania. El pasado a√±o se inauguraba parte del complejo, al que este verano se unen varios toboganes con diferente alturas y velocidades. Localizado en el norte de Portugal, a dos horas y media de Santiago, se encuentra uno de los parques acu√°ticos m√°s famosos del pa√≠s vecino: el de Amarante. Abierto en 1994, desde entonces su oferta de entretenimiento ha ido aumentando poco a poco. Entre sus instalaciones, cuenta con diferentes atracciones como una piscina de olas, toboganes en forma de tubo cubierto, √°reas con chorros de agua o diferentes toboganes con giros y su apertura. El parque abri√≥ sus puertas el pasado viernes 31 de mayo, con lo que ya puedes consultar disponibilidad y precios clickando en este enlace. Muy cerca del de Amarante encontramos otra fant√°stica opci√≥n. Hablamos del Naturwaterpark, ubicado junto de la localidad portuguesa de Vila-Real -a unas dos horas y media de Compostela- y que entr√≥ en funcionamiento el pasado jueves 30 de mayo en horario de 10:00h. a 18:30h. Adem√°s de la zona acu√°tica, que consta de atracciones √∫nicas como el Boomerang o el P√©ndulo, el complejo ofrece tambi√©n un parque de aventuras, zona de acampada y mini golf. Consulta disponibilidad y precios clickando en este enlace.

author: Sky Palma
title: Lauren Boebert's problems will haunt her in new district like Beetlejuice: analysis
text: GOP Rep. Lauren Boebert's decision to ditch her home district won't solve a problem likely to haunt the Colorado Republican like Beetlejuice, according to a new political analysis. The Independent's John Bowden argued on Thursday that the firebrand's flight to Colorado's District 4 ‚Äî and away from [two well-funded competitors in District 3 ](https://www.rawstory.com/lauren-boebert-campaign-2666806788/)‚Äî does not mean Boebert will face an easy campaign in 2024. "She‚Äôs the only incumbent House member running (so far?), giving her an advantage in name recognition and an established base of support in the state," Bowden writes. "Those advantages are not ironclad by any means." Also read: [Kari Lake hits Nikki Haley in fight for VP: Trump 'would pick anybody over her'](https://www.rawstory.com/kari-lake-nikki-haley/) Boebert may be the only incumbent House member running so far, but the name recognition she brings comes with its own burdens, Bowden argues. "The congresswoman‚Äôs undignified exit from a live-action performance of Beetlejuice earlier this year earned her viral ridicule on an entirely new level," writes Bowden, "including [a round of mockery](https://www.oregonlive.com/entertainment/2023/10/late-night-tv-hosts-return-with-jokes-about-donald-trump-taylor-swift-lauren-boebert-and-more.html) from America‚Äôs late-night hosts." Boebert is opting to run for the seat currently occupied by Republican colleague, Ken Buck, who has announced he will retire. In an online video statement, Boebert said she did not arrive at the decision easily. ‚ÄúA lot of prayer, a lot of tough conversations and a lot of perspective convinced me that this is the best way I can continue to fight for Colorado, for the conservative movement and for my children‚Äôs future,‚Äù she said. Read the full op-ed over at [The Independent](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/boebert-house-congress-colorado-2024-b2470552.html).
